verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> did see. <S%H2372><s%>

O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall I cry, <S%H7768><s%> and you will not hear! <S%H8085><s%> even cry <S%H2199><s%> out to you of violence, <S%H2555><s%> and you will not save! <S%H3467><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> do you show <S%H7200><s%> me iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and cause me to behold <S%H5027><s%> grievance? <S%H5999><s%> for spoiling <S%H7701><s%> and violence <S%H2555><s%> are before <S%H5048><s%> me: and there are that raise <S%H5375><s%> up strife <S%H7379><s%> and contention. <S%H4066><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> is slacked, <S%H6313><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%> does never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5331><s%> go <S%H3318><s%> forth: <S%H3318><s%> for the wicked <S%H7563><s%> does compass <S%H3803><s%> about the righteous; <S%H6662><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> wrong <S%H6127><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> proceeds. <S%H3318><s%>

Behold <S%H7200><s%> you among the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> and regard, <S%H5027><s%> and wonder <S%H8539><s%> marvelously: <S%H8539><s%> for I will work <S%H6466><s%> a work <S%H6467><s%> in your days <S%H3117><s%>which you will not believe, <S%H539><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> it be told <S%H5608><s%> you.

For, see, <S%H2009><s%> I raise <S%H6965><s%> up the Chaldeans, <S%H3778><s%> that bitter <S%H4751><s%> and hasty <S%H4116><s%> nation, <S%H1471><s%> which shall march <S%H1980><s%> through the breadth <S%H4800><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> to possess <S%H3423><s%> the dwelling places <S%H4908><s%> that are not their's.
They are terrible <S%H366><s%> and dreadful: <S%H3372><s%> their judgment <S%H4941><s%> and their dignity <S%H7613><s%> shall proceed <S%H3318><s%> of themselves.

Their horses <S%H5483><s%> also are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than the leopards, <S%H5246><s%> and are more fierce <S%H2300><s%> than the evening <S%H6153><s%> wolves: <S%H2061><s%> and their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> shall spread <S%H6335><s%> themselves, and their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> from far; <S%H7350><s%> they shall fly <S%H5774><s%> as the eagle <S%H5404><s%> that hastens <S%H2363><s%> to eat. <S%H398><s%>

They shall come <S%H935><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> for violence: <S%H2555><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> shall sup <S%H4041><s%> up as the east <S%H6921><s%> wind, and they shall gather <S%H622><s%> the captivity <S%H7628><s%> as the sand. <S%H2344><s%>

And they shall scoff <S%H7046><s%> at the kings, <S%H4428><s%> and the princes <S%H7336><s%> shall be a scorn <S%H4890><s%> to them: they shall deride <S%H7832><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> strong <S%H4013><s%> hold; <S%H4013><s%> for they shall heap <S%H6651><s%> dust, <S%H6083><s%> and take <S%H3920><s%> it.

Then <S%H227><s%> shall his mind <S%H7307><s%> change, <S%H2498><s%> and he shall pass <S%H5674><s%> over, <S%H5674><s%> and offend, <S%H816><s%> imputing this <S%H2098><s%> his power <S%H3581><s%> to his god. <S%H430><s%>

Are you not from everlasting, <S%H6924><s%> O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> my Holy <S%H6918><s%> One? <S%H6918><s%> we shall not die. <S%H4191><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> you have ordained <S%H7760><s%> them for judgment; <S%H4941><s%> and, O mighty <S%H6697><s%> God, <S%H6697><s%> you have established <S%H3245><s%> them for correction. <S%H3198><s%>

You are of purer <S%H2889><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%> than to behold <S%H7200><s%> evil, <S%H7451><s%> and can <S%H3201><s%> not look <S%H5027><s%> on <S%H413><s%> iniquity: <S%H5999><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> look <S%H5027><s%> you on them that deal treacherously, <S%H898><s%> and hold <S%H2790><s%> your tongue <S%H2790><s%> when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> devours <S%H1104><s%> the man that is more righteous <S%H6662><s%> than he?
And make <S%H6213><s%> men <S%H120><s%> as the fishes <S%H1709><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> as the creeping <S%H7431><s%> things, that have no <S%H3808><s%> ruler <S%H4910><s%> over them?

They take <S%H5927><s%> up all <S%H3605><s%> of them with the angle, <S%H2443><s%> they catch <S%H1641><s%> them in their net, <S%H2764><s%> and gather <S%H622><s%> them in their drag: <S%H4365><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they rejoice <S%H8055><s%> and are glad. <S%H1523><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> to their net, <S%H2764><s%> and burn <S%H6999><s%> incense <S%H6999><s%> to their drag; <S%H4365><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> by them their portion <S%H2506><s%> is fat, <S%H8082><s%> and their meat <S%H3978><s%> plenteous. <S%H1277><s%>
Shall they therefore <S%H3651><s%> empty <S%H7324><s%> their net, <S%H2764><s%> and not spare <S%H2550><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%> to slay <S%H2026><s%> the nations? <S%H1471><s%>
